meanings.definition: To attract or tempt by offering pleasure or advantage.
meanings.sent1: The colorful candies on display outside the store entice children to come inside.
meanings.sent2: The delicious smell of freshly baked cookies can entice anyone to take a bite.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to entice the birds with shiny objects to play a game.
meanings.sent4: The bright lights of the city at night entice visitors like moths to a flame.
meanings.sent5: The promise of a treasure hunt can entice even the most reluctant adventurers to join in the fun.

meanings.definition: To lure or persuade someone to do something by offering something desirable.
meanings.sent1: The toy store used a big sale to entice customers to buy more toys.
meanings.sent2: The company offered a generous bonus to entice employees to work harder.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox tried to entice the rabbit out of its burrow with promises of a grand feast.
meanings.sent4: The sweet melody of the music enticed everyone to get up and dance.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread enticed passersby to step into the bakery.
